Package gui.controllers

Class QuarterlyReportScreenController

java.lang.Object
gui.controllers.QuarterlyReportScreenController
public class QuarterlyReportScreenController extends Object
Controller for managing the monthly report screen. Handles navigation between different pages of the monthly report and returning to the previous screen.

  • Constructor Details

    • QuarterlyReportScreenController

      public QuarterlyReportScreenController(javafx.scene.layout.HBox wholeScreen, Object prevController)
      Constructs a new QuarterlyReportScreenController with the specified HBox and previous controller. This constructor initializes the fields to manage the screen layout and previous controller state.
      Parameters:
      wholeScreen - the HBox representing the entire screen layout for the report
      prevController - the previous controller, which is cast to CeoHomeScreenController

    • goBack

      public void goBack(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      Returns to the previous screen based on the previous controller.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by clicking the back button
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the screen transition

    • setScreen

      public void setScreen()
      Sets up the screen by populating the ComboBoxes with the appropriate branch, quarter, and year options. The branch and quarter ComboBoxes are populated with predefined values, while the year ComboBoxes are populated with values ranging from 1995 to the current year. This method also calls `setAllInvisible()` to initialize the visibility of elements.

    • setBranchSelection

      public void setBranchSelection()

      public void setYear2Selection()

    • updateLabel

      public void updateLabel(String msg)

    • displayReport

      public void displayReport(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Displays the quarterly report based on the user's selection. This method retrieves data for one or both selected reports, processes the data, and updates the UI with the appropriate graphs and labels. If no valid report selection is made, an error message is displayed to the user.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent that triggered the display of the report
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while retrieving the report data

    • processSingleQuarterReport

      public void processSingleQuarterReport(List<SupplierQuarterReportData> quarterReportData, javafx.scene.chart.BarChart<String,Number> incomeChart, javafx.scene.chart.BarChart<String,Number> orderChart, String type)
      Processes a single quarterly report by populating the provided bar charts with data. The method iterates through the list of supplier report data, creates data points for total income and total orders, and then adds these points to the corresponding bar charts. Additionally, it adjusts the chart width based on the number of suppliers and displays the charts based on the specified type (main or mini charts).
      Parameters:
      quarterReportData - the list of SupplierQuarterReportData containing the data for the suppliers in the selected quarter
      incomeChart - the BarChart to display the total income data
      orderChart - the BarChart to display the total orders data
      type - a String indicating the type of chart to be displayed: "Main" for the main chart, "Mini1" for the first mini chart, or "Mini2" for the second mini chart

    • displayIncomeMain

      public void displayIncomeMain()

    • displayIncomeMini1

      public void displayIncomeMini1()

    • displayIncomeMini2

      public void displayIncomeMini2()

    • displayOrdersMain

      public void displayOrdersMain()

      public void displayOrdersMini2()

    • createBarNode

      private javafx.scene.Node createBarNode(String tooltipText)
      Creates a JavaFX node with a tooltip to be used as a data point in a bar chart. The node is a label with a tooltip that displays additional information when hovered over.
      Parameters:
      tooltipText - the text to be displayed in the tooltip
      Returns:
      a Node (specifically a Label) with the specified tooltip

    • applySeriesColor

      private void applySeriesColor(javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<String,Number> series, String colorHex)
      Applies a specified color to all bars in the given chart series. This method sets the fill color of each bar in the series using the provided color hex code.
      Parameters:
      series - the XYChart.Series to which the color should be applied
      colorHex - the hex code of the color to be applied (e.g., "#FF0000" for red)

    • adjustChartWidth

      private void adjustChartWidth(int numberOfSuppliers, String type)
      Adjusts the width of the chart based on the number of suppliers and the type of chart. The method calculates the required width by considering the number of bars and gaps, and sets the minimum width and category gap for the specified chart type.
      Parameters:
      numberOfSuppliers - the number of suppliers, which determines the number of bars and gaps in the chart
      type - the type of chart to be adjusted; can be "Main", "Mini1", or "Mini2" The method performs the following adjustments based on the chart type: - "Main": Sets the minimum width and category gap for the main histogram charts. - "Mini1": Sets the minimum width and category gap for the first mini histogram charts. - "Mini2": Sets the minimum width and category gap for the second mini histogram charts.

    • clearAllSelection

      public void clearAllSelection()
      Clears all selected values from the various selection controls and resets their states. The method performs the following actions: - Clears the selection in `yearSelect`, `quarterSelect`, and `branchSelect`. - Clears the selection in `yearSelect2`, `quarterSelect2`, and `branchSelect2`. - Resets the branch, quarter, and year selections for both sets of controls to their default states.

    • setAllInvisible

      private void setAllInvisible()
      Hides all chart and scroll pane elements by setting their visibility to false. The method performs the following actions: - Hides the mini histogram charts for orders and income (`mini1OrderGraph`, `mini2OrderGraph`, `mini1IncomeGraph`, `mini2IncomeGraph`). - Hides the main histogram charts for orders and income (`ordersGraph`, `incomeGraph`). - Hides the scroll panes associated with the histograms (`mainHistogramIncomeScroll`, `mainHistogramOrdersScroll`, `miniHistogram1IncomeScroll`, `miniHistogram1OrdersScroll`, `miniHistogram2IncomeScroll`, `miniHistogram2OrdersScroll`).

    • clearAllData

      private void clearAllData()
      Clears all data from the histogram charts by removing all data series. The method performs the following actions: - Clears the data from the main histogram charts for income and orders (`mainHistogramIncome`, `mainHistogramOrders`). - Clears the data from the mini histogram charts for income and orders (`miniHistogram1Income`, `miniHistogram1Orders`, `miniHistogram2Income`, `miniHistogram2Orders`).
